net.proteusframework.internet.http

Interface ServletSession

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.proteusframework.core.Attributes<java.lang.String>, net.proteusframework.core.CoercionView<java.lang.String>

    public interface ServletSession
extends net.proteusframework.core.Attributes<java.lang.String>
    Interface defining access to a servlet session.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      • getScope

      • increaseMaxInactiveInterval

        void increaseMaxInactiveInterval(int interval,
                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Increase the maximum interval of inactivity between client requests before the Scope.SESSION scoped session is invalidated. This will create a session if one does not already exist.

        If the existing interval is greater than the specified interval, no change is made.

        If called on a session scoped other than SESSION, then this is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval.
        timeUnit - the time unit.
        See Also:
        Request.hasSession(Scope)

      • invalidate

        void invalidate()
        Unbinds any objects bound to this session. This method is specific to the scope of the session.

      • isNew

        boolean isNew()

        For Scope.APPLICATION and Scope.REQUEST scope, this method always returns true if a getter or setter is called..

        For Scope.SESSION scope, this method returns true if the client does not yet know about the session or if the client chooses not to join the session. For example, if the server used only cookie-based sessions, and the client had disabled the use of cookies, then a session would be new on each request.

        Returns:
        true or false.

      • setMaxInactiveInterval

        void setMaxInactiveInterval(int interval,
                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Specifies maximum interval of inactivity between client requests before the Scope.SESSION scoped session is invalidated. This will create a session if one does not already exist. If called on a session scoped other than SESSION, then this is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval. If 0 or less, the session timeout is indefinite.
        timeUnit - the time unit.
        See Also:
        Request.hasSession(Scope)
